lines.text: The law. Well the law is a human institution.

lines.speaker: u2392
lines.text: A miracle! It was a miracle!

lines.speaker: u2394
lines.text: Aw, don't be ignorant, Delmar. I told you they was gonna flood this valley.

lines.speaker: u2392
lines.text: That ain't it!

lines.speaker: u2393
lines.text: Pappy O'Daniel be laughing' then.

lines.speaker: u2403
lines.text: Not out the other side his face, though.

lines.speaker: u2393
lines.text: Oh no, no, just the reg'la side -

lines.speaker: u2394
lines.text: Hot damn, boy, I almost believe you did sell your soul to the devil!

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: Boys, that was some mighty fine pickin' and singin'. You just sign these papers and I'll give you ten dollars apiece.

lines.speaker: u2394
lines.text: Okay sir, but Mert and Aloysius'll have to scratch Xes - only four of us can write.

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: Now what can I do you for, Mister French?

lines.speaker: u2395
lines.text: How can I lay hold a the Soggy Bottom Boys?

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: Soggy Bottom Boys - I don't precisely recollect, uh -

lines.speaker: u2395
lines.text: They cut a record in here, few days ago, old-timey harmony thing with a guitar Accump-accump-uh-

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: Oh I remember 'em, colored fellas I believe, swell bunch a boys, sung into yon can and skedaddled.

lines.speaker: u2395
lines.text: Well that record has just gone through the goddamn roof! They're playin' it as far away as Mobile! The whole damn state's goin' ape!

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: It was a powerful air.

lines.speaker: u2395
lines.text: Hot damn, we gotta find those boys! Sign 'em to a big fat contract! Hell's bells, Mr. Lunn, if we don't the goddamn competition will!

lines.speaker: u2397
lines.text: Oh mercy, yes. You gotta beat that competition.

lines.speaker: u2399
lines.text: Holy-moly. These boys're a hit!

lines.speaker: u2396
lines.text: But Pappy, they's inter-grated.

lines.speaker: u2399
lines.text: Well I guess folks don't mind they's integrated.

lines.speaker: u2398
lines.text: She's at the five and dime.

lines.speaker: u2404
lines.text: Buyin' nipples!

lines.speaker: u2405
lines.text: I knew you'd make it!  Where's your girl? Didn't she come?

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: Naw. That's over with.

lines.speaker: u2406
lines.text: Go on, Zack! Go for the record!

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: Fuck the record. Now you listen to me and do exactly what I tell you.  Start back ten yards and take off from here. Not here... or there... but right here!  No excuses, Seeger! You are going to plant those legs here and then you're going to yank yourself over that wall because you have to! You want jets? Then do it, goddamnit!

lines.speaker: u2407
lines.text: He doesn't mean anything by it, Zack. Do you, Joe?

lines.speaker: u2410
lines.text: I don't mean anything by it.

lines.speaker: u2408
lines.text: I know why most of you are here. We're not stupid. But before you get to sell what we teach you over at United Airlines, you gotta give the Navy six years of your life, Sweet Pea. Lot of things can happen in six year. Another war could come up in six years. If you're too peaceful a person to dump napalm on an enemy village where there might be women and children, I'm gonna find that out. Understand?

lines.speaker: u2409
lines.text: Yes, sir!

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Don't you dare ask me that question. I'm an adult and you got no right to push your nose into my affairs like that!

lines.speaker: u2410
lines.text: Well, as long as you live in this house, young lady, you live by my rules! You should be dating local boys.

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Uh-uh! Not a chance! There's nobody in this town doing anything with his life, except what his father did, which is nothing. If I can't have more out of life than that, I'd rather be dead!

lines.speaker: u2410
lines.text: Do you honestly think you'll find a boy in that... that officer's school who's serious about marriage?

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Yes I do!

lines.speaker: u2410
lines.text: Then you're dumber than I thought! All you'll get from their kind is pregnant!

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: You little bitch! How could you? Was there ever a baby, Lynette? That's all I want to know! Did you make up that baby, Lynette? Did you??

lines.speaker: u2411
lines.text: Of course there was a baby. I'd never lie about something like that. Would I, Paula?

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Please stop it. None of that's true. Goddamnit, I love you. I loved you ever since I met you.

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: Come on, Paula! You were looking for a ticket out of here and you didn't care who it was, any more than you cared with the last class of candidates you and Lynette fucked your way through, looking for a husband! Or the class before that!

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Yeah. You got the whole story just right.

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: Beware of the Puget Debs -- and we all laughed, especially him.

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: I'm not a Puget Deb. I hate that goddamn term!

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: I bet you do!

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: However you got it figured, I didn't kill Sid and Lynette didn't kill him! He killed himself!

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: That's brilliant.

lines.speaker: u2412
lines.text: Maybe not, but it is the truth. And Zack, you didn't kill him either.

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: How about that prick! He told me he wasn't officer material because he grew up poor like me.

lines.speaker: u2413
lines.text: He said he grew up poor?

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: The kid on the windy side of the baker's window. That's how he put it.

lines.speaker: u2413
lines.text: Foley's not poor. Buddy of mine in oh-four told me he's the son of a rich doctor down in Louisiana.

lines.speaker: u2414
lines.text: Please, Zack -- go back to the barracks!

lines.speaker: u2415
lines.text: I don't get it! He's the best candidate in our class! Ask anyone! The best student! The best leader! The best friend to everybody! Couldn't you bend your goddamn standards just a little?

lines.speaker: u2414
lines.text: Zack, it wasn't him! He didn't ask me to D.O.R. I came to him on my own.  I'm glad it's over, Zack. I really mean that. He was right. I wasn't doing this for me.

lines.speaker: u2416
lines.text: You walk out that door and you lose your share of the money.

lines.speaker: u2419
lines.text: Yeah, whatever.

lines.speaker: u2416
lines.text: I mean it!

lines.speaker: u2419
lines.text: Adios.

lines.speaker: u2417
lines.text: May I ask what the rest of that sentence was going to be?

lines.speaker: u2421
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: u2417
lines.text: The sentence that started "There are three."  What was the rest?

lines.speaker: u2418
lines.text: Push that button for me, will you?

lines.speaker: u2421
lines.text: Don't!

lines.speaker: u2419
lines.text: Suit yourself.

lines.speaker: u2422
lines.text: Nobody leaves.

lines.speaker: u2419
lines.text: Observe.

lines.speaker: u2420
lines.text: Old Bernie didn't miss a trick with this room, did he?

lines.speaker: u2421
lines.text: Open the door.

lines.speaker: u2420
lines.text: And with kids like he's got, no wonder he wanted a place to hide.

lines.speaker: u2423
lines.text: Where is the Glucogen?

lines.speaker: u2421
lines.text: Oh, you know, it's uh... it's in the little fridge in your room.

lines.speaker: u2423
lines.text: I'm sorry, Mom.

lines.speaker: u2421
lines.text: Hey, quit apologizing, you're starting to sound like Grandma. You're not gonna have an attack. Okay?

lines.speaker: u2423
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u2424
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: u2442
lines.text: You gotta. You gotta stay alive. You know what they were trying to do here. You got the pigs dead to rights. It's like Huey said, you're more important than any of us.

lines.speaker: u2425
lines.text: For the last time Boy!!! What do those guns mean??!!

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: They mean, Pig!, that the Black Panther Party declares that if you try to brutalize our community or take our weapons.  We are going to shoot you!!!

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: You got to sit on Eldridge...

lines.speaker: u2426
lines.text: Man, El-Rage is El-Rage. You know him.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: Yeah, I do, but he's gotta cool it...

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: ...The police report says he was shot three times but the coroner's report says quite clearly that Denzil Dowell was shot six times. And two of those shots were in his armpits. Brothers and Sisters you know why that is?  Because Denzil had his hands up!!

lines.speaker: u2427
lines.text: No more police brutality! WHAT DO WE WANT?

lines.speaker: u2428
lines.text: Go! Run! Go on! Get the fuck out of here!!

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: What? So you can shoot me? Call it resisting arrest?

lines.speaker: u2428
lines.text: I ain't gonna shoot you Judge. Look... it's over. Just run away. Get out. Stay away from Oakland. Cause it's gone... it's gone.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Brimmer you're fucked up...

lines.speaker: u2428
lines.text: Yeah... I'm fucked up. You're fucked up. Government's fucked up. Whole country's fucked up. You got no idea what's going on here. This is bigger than you and me. We're just little tiny soldiers getting moved around on some big asshole's desk. The Panthers... fuck you're history... they killed you and you don't even know it.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Who's they?

lines.speaker: u2428
lines.text: Drugs Judge, they're gonna flood West Oakland with dope. Jack you up and string you out like a two dollar whore. And while the community's shuffling for a fix, they're gonna snuff every Panther they can find.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Who? I mean besides the FBI?

lines.speaker: u2428
lines.text: I don't know. Except, it's one of you. Maybe not a Panther, but it's someone from the neighborhood. Judge. Look, just go. Get away. It's over. You lost.  We all lost.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Cy... Cy... Oh shit man... who did this to you. Was it the pigs?

lines.speaker: u2438
lines.text: I don't think that will be any problem...

lines.speaker: u2430
lines.text: You talk as if this thing's already been decided.

lines.speaker: u2431
lines.text: But lots of our people don't read, man. They need strong imagery to help them out.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: Yeah... then shouldn't this be all of us together.

lines.speaker: u2431
lines.text: Trust me Huey, this picture will be worth a thousand words. Now have you given any thought to that Peace and Freedom Party thing. They really want to hook up with us. Do a rally together. Hell it'd broaden our base of visibility.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: Yeah, but aligning with white organizations. I'm not sure now's the time.

lines.speaker: u2431
lines.text: The time, my friend, is what Sartre called, "the moment the match is being put to the fuse." Question is, is the hand holding that match gonna be black or white.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: ...no full fledge alliance. But I think we should do a rally with them. Show that there's some common ground between Black and White. You all with that?  All right then Eldridge, set it up.

lines.speaker: u2432
lines.text: Did you shoot the officers in question?

lines.speaker: u2433
lines.text: Again I'll take the fifth amendment on that question.

lines.speaker: u2434
lines.text: Well, then we're going to take that power away from those bastards.

lines.speaker: u2438
lines.text: You mean...

lines.speaker: u2434
lines.text: Yes, that's exactly what I mean. And Agent Rodgers?... This conversation never occurred.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: I don't know man. I don't know. That reminds me.  Another little donation from the police.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: If the pigs only knew they were subsidizing The Panthers...

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Yeah well, they want a lot for their money. They want a felony, preferably with "violent intent." We've got to give them something. They'll kill me if I don't. And the Panthers are going to kill me if I do. I'm scared.

lines.speaker: u2435
lines.text: Me too. That's why I fight so hard.

lines.speaker: u2437
lines.text: You meet those friends of yours in jail too?

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Yes... No... Mom it's not like you think. They're alright. There out there trying to do something.

lines.speaker: u2437
lines.text: I hear them boys, those Black Panthers, they're communists. They don't even believe in God.

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: Mom, black folks been praying to God for four hundred years. Maybe it's time we tried something else...

lines.speaker: u2437
lines.text: You believe that?

lines.speaker: u2436
lines.text: I don't know. I really don't.

lines.speaker: u2443
lines.text: Next time we'll bring more blankets.

lines.speaker: u2448
lines.text: That would be nice.

lines.speaker: u2443
lines.text: Maybe we'll be lucky this winter and have just rain, no snow.

lines.speaker: u2448
lines.text: That would be nice, too.

lines.speaker: u2444
lines.text: You got salt last week.

lines.speaker: u2448
lines.text: Oh, right.  Baking powder, we need baking powder.

lines.speaker: u2444
lines.text: We've got plenty of baking powder. You went to Pembroke and got five pounds two weeks ago.

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Two pounds, fourteen ounces.

lines.speaker: u2445
lines.text: Lovely.

lines.speaker: u2446
lines.text: We did.

lines.speaker: u2457
lines.text: With a lace table cloth?

lines.speaker: u2447
lines.text: Do you see that, Colonel?

lines.speaker: u2457
lines.text: Unless I'm dreaming, I think I see irregulars at their center.

lines.speaker: u2448
lines.text: There are some letters here from him.  Some are just to you.

lines.speaker: u2456
lines.text: I don't care.  I hate him.

lines.speaker: u2448
lines.text: You don't hate him.

lines.speaker: u2456
lines.text: Yes, I do.  I hate him and I hope he never comes back.

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Your son, what did you name him?

lines.speaker: u2449
lines.text: Robert.  Robert E. Lee.

lines.speaker: u2450
lines.text: Lord Cornwallis will be with you presently.

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u2450
lines.text: You may, of course, keep your weapons, but I must warn you that...

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: I'm familiar with appropriate behavior at a military parley.

lines.speaker: u2450
lines.text: Yes, quite, but you should know that...

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: That will be all, Major.  I'll wait for Lord Cornwallis.

lines.speaker: u2450
lines.text: Yes... you will wait.

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Margaret, take William and Susan to the river shed.  Hide there.  If we're not back by dawn, go up the river to the Richardson's house. They'll take you to your Aunt Charlotte's farm.  Nathan, Samuel, and I are going to get Gabriel.

lines.speaker: u2451
lines.text: But what about Thomas?

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Leave him.  Take care of William and Susan.

lines.speaker: u2453
lines.text: Father... I killed those men...

lines.speaker: u2452
lines.text: Don't blame yourself, you did what I told you to do.

lines.speaker: u2453
lines.text: I'm glad I killed them... I'm glad...

lines.speaker: u2460
lines.text: Do you swear?

lines.speaker: u2462
lines.text: I swear.

lines.speaker: u2462
lines.text: I'll bite--what's the bottom of the truth, Jud?

lines.speaker: u2461
lines.text: Why...that sometimes dead is better. That's all. Sometimes dead is better.

lines.speaker: u2462
lines.text: You better get going, hon.

lines.speaker: u2464
lines.text: Oh Louis, I just don't know about this--

lines.speaker: u2462
lines.text: I told you last night--this can be the start of patching things up with your folks. If something good doesn't come of Gage's death, I think I'll go crazy.

lines.speaker: u2464
lines.text: Louis, are you sure?

lines.speaker: u2462
lines.text: I'm sure.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: AnaMaria, trim the mainsail!

lines.speaker: u2465
lines.text: Aye, aye, sir!

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: Mr. Gibbs, organize a cleaning detail -- you and Cotton.  I want every inch of the Pearl spic-and- span and ship-shape!

lines.speaker: u2466
lines.text: Agreed.  You have my word, as a gentleman of fortune --

lines.speaker: u2467
lines.text: Will -- you can't trust him.

lines.speaker: u2467
lines.text: You didn't tell Commodore Norrington everything.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: Nor did you, I noticed.

lines.speaker: u2467
lines.text: He might delay the rescue ... and that would be too late.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.speaker: u2467
lines.text: These men will be facing an enemy that seemingly cannot be killed.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: I have a plan.  If it succeeds, then any battle will be decidedly brief ... and one-sided.

lines.speaker: u2467
lines.text: What's your plan?

lines.speaker: u2476
lines.text: We can at least fight -- we might be able to kill a few--

lines.speaker: u2468
lines.text: Will -- it'll go worse for us -- for Elizabeth, especially -- if we fight.

lines.speaker: u2469
lines.text: Sir, I'll not see any of my men killed or wounded in this foolish enterprise.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: Fine by me.  We brought you a nice little boat, so you can all get back to shore, safe and sound.

lines.speaker: u2469
lines.text: Agreed.  You have the momentary advantage, sir.  But I will see you smile from the yard arm, sir.

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: As likely as not.  Will, short up the anchor, we've got ourselves a ship!

lines.speaker: u2476
lines.text: Well, you're the worst pirate I've ever heard of.  You're a man who can be trusted, who can be counted on, and who can't betray his friends.  What kind of pirate is that?

lines.speaker: u2470
lines.text: The worst.  On the other hand, maybe I'm a man who can't pass up a chance for revenge against the black-hearted bastard who stole my ship and left me to die in the middle of the ocean -- twice! -- and who knows how to get what he wants.  Now that's a great pirate.

lines.speaker: u2472
lines.text: That Jack Sparrow ... he talked about the Black Pearl.

lines.speaker: u2471
lines.text: Mentioned it, is more what he did.

lines.speaker: u2472
lines.text: Still --

lines.speaker: u2475
lines.text: Commodore --

lines.speaker: u2473
lines.text: A moment.

lines.speaker: u2475
lines.text: But --

lines.speaker: u2473
lines.text: Please.

lines.speaker: u2475
lines.text: Dammit, man, it appears someone is stealing your ship!

lines.speaker: u2477
lines.text: It'll be better for us if he simply disappears.  The gardener will know what to do.

lines.speaker: u2480
lines.text: Wait, wait, can I at least have his body?

lines.speaker: u2477
lines.text: Donated to science.  Perfect.

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: Here, kid, this is great stuff.  Why don't you give it a try?

lines.speaker: u2478
lines.text: I want Trix!  Mommy!

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: What is it with you litterbugs?  Is it a territorial thing, marking your turf with your garbage?

lines.speaker: u2479
lines.text: You better quit pushing me, pal.

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: I just want to know what goes on in the mind of a litterbug.  What chemical is secreted by your smooth brain that tells you, 'It's okay, just chuck it'?

lines.speaker: u2479
lines.text: Look, asshole, I don't got time for this.  If you got a problem, you better take care of it yourself.

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: Oh no, no, no.  No can do.  You enjoyed a tasty beverage and thus this receptacle becomes your responsibility and I don't care if it's a Styrofoam cup or the Exxon Valdez!  You've got to learn to take responsibility!

lines.speaker: u2479
lines.text: What are you going to do?  Make me throw it out?

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: I'll do whatever I have to do.

lines.speaker: u2480
lines.text: Susan!

lines.speaker: u2483
lines.text: Wellie well, Dr. Bright.  You're just in time.

lines.speaker: u2483
lines.text: Maybe you're ready to find out if that hide of yours is bulletproof?

lines.speaker: u2481
lines.text: The question is, are you?

lines.speaker: u2484
lines.text: Okay, Barbie, let's get this over with.

lines.speaker: u2482
lines.text: Don't worry, four eyes.

lines.speaker: u2484
lines.text: What in the hell?

lines.speaker: u2483
lines.text: Pipe down, brain lady!  And you...

lines.speaker: u2485
lines.text: Why doesn't Dexter show some decency? And you might show some too, Mother. What do you expect a man to do when he's called such names?  I'm glad you hit that reporter, Stewart. He deserved it.

lines.speaker: u2493
lines.text: All right, all right! It's your funeral, Anne Schuyler!

lines.speaker: u2486
lines.text: Well, Stew, that's all thrashed out. By golly, I'm surely glad to see that you're not really sore. You know our racket - after all, news is news.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Sure, sure. That's all right. That was a great story, Bingy. A great story - wish I'd printed it.

lines.speaker: u2486
lines.text: I gave you the breaks, didn't I? That hairy chest story!

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: You've raised it up to the chin, I see.  Go on in the other room and get yourself a drink.

lines.speaker: u2487
lines.text: Well, I'm sorry to see a good reporter go blooey혰  Let me know when you're quitting.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: I'm not quitting!

lines.speaker: u2487
lines.text: No?

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u2487
lines.text: 'For he's only a bird in a gilded cage, a beautiful sight to see혰'  Tweet, tweet - ha, ha혰

lines.speaker: u2488
lines.text: That's a canary, sir.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: That's a canary! Who brought that in here? Canary, huh? Go on, get that out of here. Get that out of here!

lines.speaker: u2488
lines.text: Yes, sir. Very good, sir.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: A bird! A bird in a gilded cage! Get that thing out of here!

lines.speaker: u2488
lines.text: Yes sir!

lines.speaker: u2489
lines.text: What other girl혰?

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: The little O'Brien girl, of course - the one you suggested in the story.

lines.speaker: u2489
lines.text: But that's ridiculous! You can't make a sudden change like that.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Gallagher, what are you going to do - tell me how to write a play?

lines.speaker: u2489
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: There's nothing sudden about that혰  He's always loved the girl, but he was such a sap he didn't have sense enough to tell her. Well, that's all right - we can fix that. He will go to the little O'Brien girl, and - here, I'll show you.

lines.speaker: u2490
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: And now for that twentieth crack혰

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: I'm sorry nobody could come.

lines.speaker: u2491
lines.text: The rest of the gang had to get out the morning edition - but they'll be down later.

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Now Hank, are you sure they're coming?  It will be lonesome without them.  Smythe, take this crowd in there and give them a drink. And find out what the boys in the back room want!

lines.speaker: u2493
lines.text: What's going on here? Who is this woman?

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Joan of Arc! What's it to you?

lines.speaker: u2493
lines.text: Heavens! The man's insane!

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Sure I'm insane, but I've got some good news for you.  This magnolia is leaving your sweet smelling vanilla joint. This bird in a cage is gonna button his own pants from now on. And that is what is known as telling the mother- in-law.

lines.speaker: u2494
lines.text: It isn't done, gentlemen! It isn't done, I say! It isn't done!

lines.speaker: u2495
lines.text: Well, Gallagher, you certainly took no chances, did you?

lines.speaker: u2496
lines.text: I made a couple of lunches for you and put them in brown paper bags ...  I'm gonna go now.

lines.speaker: u2504
lines.text: Where are you gonna go?

lines.speaker: u2496
lines.text: I'm gonna go now.

lines.speaker: u2502
lines.text: What'll it be?

lines.speaker: u2497

lines.speaker: u2744

lines.speaker: u2746
lines.text: What?  Colleen?... Colleen?

lines.speaker: u2747
lines.text: Five. The five longest.

lines.speaker: u2745
lines.text: Boy, why aren't you in the pros making stacks of cash and getting handfuls of T and A?

lines.speaker: u2749
lines.text: The truck... the truck has severed most of her lower half.

lines.speaker: u2746
lines.text: What did you say?

lines.speaker: u2748
lines.text: The book says they're probably very good problem solvers.

lines.speaker: u2747
lines.text: What book!

lines.speaker: u2748
lines.text: They'll find a way in.

lines.speaker: u2751
lines.text: If we charge them, they won't have a chance. But we gotta get to the horses.

lines.speaker: u2750
lines.text: What do you mean, the horses?

lines.speaker: u2751
lines.text: You might make a farmer yet.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: I've got a job.

lines.speaker: u2752
lines.text: That's a lie.

lines.speaker: u2760
lines.text: Tomorrow we're going to town to straighten that out once and for all. The next day we'll be back here... farming. And these cattle better be gone.

lines.speaker: u2753
lines.text: A lot of men have told me that. Maybe it's true. I guess some women are slow to believe it.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: Believe it.

lines.speaker: u2753
lines.text: They're drawn to me by that. But it never lasts.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u2753
lines.text: Because they don't like what I want.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: u2753
lines.text: I want to build something, make things grow. That takes hard work -- a lifetime of it. That's not why men come to a pretty woman.

lines.speaker: u2757
lines.text: It was not -- it was Murdo's. Those McKendricks don't know how to act like human beings.

lines.speaker: u2755
lines.text: His son is worse than he was. He's smoother, so you don't always hear him coming, but he'll do anything to keep his range free.

lines.speaker: u2757
lines.text: I'm worried what he's going to do when he finds out you boys are back.

lines.speaker: u2756
lines.text: New record.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: Let's get out of here.

lines.speaker: u2758
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.speaker: u2765
lines.text: I'm done talking. Get out.

lines.speaker: u2758
lines.text: You can't do this.

lines.speaker: u2765
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u2759
lines.text: The jury saw it differently.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: So this is the guy you're going to hang?

lines.speaker: u2759
lines.text: Tomorrow morning. Ten o'clock.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: I was afraid of that.

lines.speaker: u2760
lines.text: Yeah, it's working out real good.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: Where's Emmett now?

lines.speaker: u2765
lines.text: Things are getting messy around here.  I hear Ezra Johnson got himself killed.

lines.speaker: u2761
lines.text: I heard that too.

lines.speaker: u2765
lines.text: Did you hear his son is still around?

lines.speaker: u2766
lines.text: I've got a place I can hide her.

lines.speaker: u2762
lines.text: You better get in there with her until this thing is over.

lines.speaker: u2766
lines.text: From what I've seen, Paden doesn't care much about money.

lines.speaker: u2765
lines.text: He says he doesn't care about anything, but he does. There's just no telling what it's going to be.

lines.speaker: u2767
lines.text: Can you tell us why you were disposing of the body of a woman who didn't exist?

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: It wasn't her body.  It was her body of work.

lines.speaker: u2767
lines.text: Why don't you just come clean, Viktor?  Tell the truth.  You'll feel better afterwards.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: I am telling the truth.

lines.speaker: u2767
lines.text: We all know what happened.  In a fit of jealous rage you killed Simone and dumped her body off a boat she bought for you.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: No!!  I can prove it to you.  I'll take you to her.

lines.speaker: u2768
lines.text: I can't believe she's doing this -- taking advantage of him this way. It's cruel.

lines.speaker: u2774
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u2768
lines.text: Obviously, this can't last.  She's going to dump him.  Viktor won't be able to take that.  He's too sensitive.  It'll destroy him.

lines.speaker: u2774
lines.text: Elaine, do you realize you can't stop talking about Viktor?

lines.speaker: u2768
lines.text: I have to talk to her.

lines.speaker: u2769
lines.text: "Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here".

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: Please put your clothes on

lines.speaker: u2782
lines.text: With everything that was going on in my life, I just needed to drop out of sight for a while -- I needed time.  Viktor bought me that time.  I owe him so much.

lines.speaker: u2770
lines.text: We all do.  But now I understand you're eager to get back to work -- and not the kind of work that we're all expecting.

lines.speaker: u2782
lines.text: That's true.  I can reveal that I am considering a career in politics.

lines.speaker: u2770
lines.text: And what may I ask brought this on?

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: No.  In fact, between us, she doesn't really exist.

lines.speaker: u2771
lines.text: Simone!

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: You already do.  But my actor won't get old, fat, lazy or drunk -- won't throw tantrums, demand a body double, script changes or a bigger trailer.  The Disney Corporation has been using artificial actors for years.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: That's the point, Hank.  No matter how good they are, they're still Mickey Mouse.  Everyone's tried. Everyone's failed.  It can't be done.

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: It can -- with my new computer code, you and me, we can do it together.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: I don't know anything about computers.

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: That's why you're so perfect.  You have something I don't have.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: An eye -- for performance.  You know the truth when you see it.  I know.  I've seen your movies.  I love your movies.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: "Straw God" changed my life.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: You saw that?

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: I've seen every frame of your work. You're the only filmmaker in Hollywood with the artistic integrity to realize my vision. You and me, art and science... we are the perfect marriage.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: Listen, Hank, it's been a rough day.  I'll call you about his next week.

lines.speaker: u2772
lines.text: I won't be here next week.  The tumor's inoperable.  I'll be dead.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: I'm already dead.

lines.speaker: u2780
lines.text: Harry!  Harry!  Can we have a minute?  What brings you here tonight?

lines.speaker: u2773
lines.text: I just came out to support my good friend, Simone.

lines.speaker: u2780
lines.text: There's a rumor that you're more than just "good friends"?

lines.speaker: u2773
lines.text: We've been seeing each other, sure, but we'd rather keep our relationship private.

lines.speaker: u2780
lines.text: Do I hear the sound of... wedding bells?

lines.speaker: u2773
lines.text: I can't believe you people!  No wonder she never comes to these things!

lines.speaker: u2775
lines.text: About you and mom?

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: Me and Simone.  What I did.

lines.speaker: u2775
lines.text: Your mistake wasn't making something fake, daddy.  We're fine with fake -- as long as you don't lie about it.

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: -- No!  I can't go along with this horseshit!  Just tell them they can fry me!

lines.speaker: u2776
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: u2784
lines.text: It was premeditated -- I knew exactly what I was doing!  I strangled her!  I bludgeoned her! I set her on fire!  I did it!  I killed her!
